https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/32268/ : SUCCESS

This can be named as systemDumpPath to be more appropriate. 
Can you move this to the section where it is consumed ? ie. line 928. then it need not be passed into the lambda
Again I must be capturing dumpType in the lambda and have this check on 923 and add the msg to the redfish resp
NotAllowed to resourceInStandby seems like an odd mapping

This was the error (NotAllowed) that is returned by the backend when the host is powered off.

But the error that is returned to the client (resourceInStandby) is quite relevant to the host powered off scenario.

https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish/issues/4850 has the DMTF recommendations for this kind of use-cases 
resourceInStandby seems OK for this case
But you have NotAllowed above
I will remove it

Can you be more clear about this comment here? 
Does this mean that if any kind of invalid arguments are passed / arguments are missing, there is no different errors thrown by the dbus. Thus bmcweb can not differentiate the specific error. So you are returning 500?

There are different errors returned, so it can be differentiated.

But, here what I meant is, if there are any errors in the createdump call made from the bmcweb code (bad path mentioned below), the response would be internal error because the client has nothing to do with the internal implementation of bmcweb and it is not a user error.

Errors:
------

1. busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Manager1 /xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Create CreateDump                 

Call failed: The name is not activatable

Journal log:
CreateDump resp_handler got error generic:113; message: No route to host


2. busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Manager /xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resource xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Create CreateDump a{sv} 1 "com.ibm.Dump.Create.CreateParameters.VSPString" s "str"                                   
                 
Call failed: Invalid argument was given.

Journal log:
CreateDump resp_handler got error generic:5; message: Input/output error

3. busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Manager /xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Create CreateDump1

Call failed: Unknown method CreateDump1 or interface xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Create.

Journal log:
CreateDump resp_handler got error generic:53; message: Invalid request descriptor

4. busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Manager /xyz/openbmc_project/dump/bmc xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Create CreateDump 

Call failed: Invalid arguments '' to call xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Create.CreateDump(), expecting 'a{sv}'.

Journal log:
CreateDump resp_handler got error generic:22; message: Invalid argument
It should be checked as what all kind of errors are possible when a redfish user gives wrong input values in the request. Not the direct dbus command execution
any errors in the user inputs are handled already (initial lines in the createdump method) and the validation will be taken care by the backend.
Ack

It should be the backend who checks this and returns this error. No check needed here for the dumpType. bmcweb will need to always map the xyz.openbmc_project.Dump.Create.Error.Disabled to serviceDisabled

Since this createDump call is for both bmc and host dumps, and the creation of host dumps only will be returning this error, we need to have a check if it is System and then hardcode the dump path in line 930.

Not sure if it is right if we donot have any check for dump type and simply hardcode the System logentry path in 930 line
Ack. Seems ok

> Since this createDump call is for both bmc and host dumps, and the creation of host dumps only will be returning this error, we need to have a check if it is System and then hardcode the dump path in line 930.

I don't understand this statement, especially the part about "the creation of host dumps only will be returning this error".  We need consistent interfaces, if we're inconsistent, we shouldn't be making things consistent by hardcoding specific names here.

> I don't understand this statement, especially the part about "the creation of host dumps only will be returning this error".  We need consistent interfaces, if we're inconsistent, we shouldn't be making things consistent by hardcoding specific names here.

+1.
The dump manager returns this error for system dumps when the dump policy is disabled. There is no dump policy enable/disable flag option for the bmc dump.
But there is no reason the bmc dump manager could not return Create.Error.Disabled.
Ack
Done
Prefer to return here and remove the else on the next line.
Ack
Done
While we're here, this return does nothing and can be removed.
Ack
Done. Made changes in the new PS
50/72 please.
Done
Not done.  Current patchset appears to wrap 50/50
Done
what if it's neither type?  Internal error?

Done. 
Handled in line line 889
Still not done in latest patchset.

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/48057/16/redfish-core/lib/log_services.hpp#889

Have made the change here. so if it is neither of these two, it would return with internal error.
but anyways with your latest comment, this if statement will be removed.
Can you provide link to related API change? This change looks good to me, but unless both changes are introduced at the same time it will cause errors.

The backend returned different error responses even earlier.
But bmcweb just sends back "internal error". so this commit is to enhance the error that is returned to the client by picking the error from the backend and return corresponding error in redfish response.
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Dump/Create.interface.yaml
Ohh I think I understand now. sdbusplus::message::message is additional parameter which can be retrieved from dbus. It's not part of the API. Is it how it works?

> sdbusplus::message::message is additional parameter which can be retrieved from dbus call

Yes

Considering we already have a switch statment for these, can we just build dumpPath on lines 870 and pass that through instead of dumpType?  That would be clearer, and reduce the possibility that we hit errors here.
Done
